key_work.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
key_work.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
key_work.brief_description: Two showgirls go to Paris in search of rich husbands in this musical comedy which is memorable for the score and songs such as “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend”. Starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russell and Charles Coburn. Based on the novel by Anita Loos.

start.title: Crafting the ideal
start.last_on_display_place: Australian Centre for the Moving Image
start.brief_description: Marilyn Monroe’s floor-length pink gown from Gentlemen Prefer Blondes (1953) is one of cinema’s most famous costumes. From music videos to action films, this iconic look has been remixed and reinterpreted by countless celebrities.

end.title: Moulin Rouge!
end.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Knapman, Catherine Martin, Fred Baron, Martin Brown, Philip Martin Brown and Steve E. Andrews
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2001
end.brief_description: A celebration of love and creative inspiration takes place in the infamous, gaudy and glamorous Parisian nightclub, at the cusp of the 20th century. A young poet, who is plunged into the heady world of Moulin Rouge, begins a passionate affair with the club’s most notorious and beautiful star.

constellations_other.name: Pink subversions
constellations_other.description: Pink dominates Angela Tiatia's The Dark Current. The artist describes this particular colour as “artificial”, “unapologetic” and “pulsating with feminine energy”. In Tiatia's Sāmoan heritage “there is a brashness in the use of colour. I really wanted to embody that.”

constellations_other.name: Gender avengers
constellations_other.description: Thelma and Louise and Promising Young Woman both celebrate women taking revenge on men who sexually assault them, although victory is temporary as the characters perish because of their choices.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

end.title: Kylie Minogue: White Diamond
end.creator_credit: William Baker, Mark 'REG' Wrench, Kylie Minogue, Tom Colbourne and Blink TV
end.brief_description: White Diamond is a 2007 documentary film directed and produced by William Baker and chronicling the life of Australian singer Kylie Minogue during her Showgirl: The Greatest Hits Tour in 2005. White Diamond was filmed between August 2006 and March 2007 in both Australia and the United Kingdom and follows Australian pop singer-songwriter Kylie Minogue on concert tour before and during her resurrected Showgirl: The Homecoming Tour, originally abandoned halfway through its original 2005 run, in Sydney, when Minogue was diagnosed with breast cancer. Intended as a document of Minogue’s return to the stage following her treatment and recovery from cancer, the film also features on-stage and back-stage footage and interviews with a number of Minogue’s tour crew, including Baker himself.
